results.title: Birth with Dr. R.D. Laing
results.creator_credit: Media Insights, Helen Brew and Sam Pillsbury
results.brief_description: Questions and challenges many aspects of modern childbirth practices. Poses such questions as: why do mothers have little say in the services that exist entirely for them? Why does this occasion for the celebration of life turn so often into an emotional and biological disaster? R. D. Laing talks about his ideas on childbirth. A group of mothers discuss their experiences in hospitals.

results.title: Birth rediscovered
results.brief_description: A documentary about childbirth at home. This program traces the experience, during the final 24 hours up to the birth of the child of a couple who have decided to have their baby at home.
results.description: A documentary about childbirth at home. This program traces the experience, during the final 24 hours up to the birth of the child of a couple who have decided to have their baby at home.

results.title: Birth of the red kangaroo
results.brief_description: Shows mating, the female kangaroo’s preparation for the birth of her young and birth itself. Explains the significance of the oestrous cycle and gestation period, egg fertilization, and the development of the embryo in the uterus. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Birth of the Bomb (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This is the background story of the making of the first atomic bomb. The period covered is from 1938 to the dropping of the bomb on Hiroshima in 1945. German efforts to create an atomic bomb are described. the intensive research into the development of the bomb in the US is dealt with extensively. Includes archival film and interviews with some of those involved.

results.title: Birth of language (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: High Road Productions Inc and Paul Jay
results.brief_description: The Birth of Language explores the origin of human language. It examines the differences between human language and animal communication, the relationship of language and thought. The film traces the evolution of humans and their separation from animals.
results.creator_credit_for_label: High Road Productions Inc and Paul Jay

results.title: Birth of an oilfield
results.brief_description: Shows how an oil well is drilled and crude oil is brought up from the ground and started on its way to the refinery. While live action is used to show glimpses of a drilling crew at work animation reveals what is taking place below the surface of the ground. No credits available.
results.description: Shows how an oil well is drilled and crude oil is brought up from the ground and started on its way to the refinery. results.title: Birth of an island
results.brief_description: Shows the formation of the new volcanic island of Surtsey near Iceland, beginning as a submarine eruption and building up to a substantiasl lava shield of several square miles. Covers the changes in activity of the volcano and investigation by landing parties. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Birth of a port
results.creator_credit: Cinesound Movietone, Harold Dews and William M. Carty
results.brief_description: Discusses the development by the Maritime Services Board of deep-water facilities in Botany Bay, New South Wales, so that it can be used as a port for large shipping.

results.title: Birth of a monster
results.brief_description: Ocean Digger an off-shore oil drilling rig is the monster - ugly, unwieldy, gigantic, with a mammoth job to do in the off-shore search for oil and gas. Her construction, launching and fitting out at the Whyalla shipyards are shown in detail. Narrated by Terry Norris.
